did.unittitle: United States, Confederate States, and foreign currency collection

physdesc.extent: in one manuscript box and one oversize box.

did.abstract: This collection contains bank notes, fractional currency, postage stamps, and treasury notes, most of which were printed in the United States. Also included are various forms of paper currency printed by the Confederate States of America during the Civil War, as well as currency printed by various foreign countries, such as Brazil, China, Dominican Republic, and Japan. Two bound volumes containing historical sketches of paper money printed in the continental United States and the State of Pennsylvania are also included.

processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level by Nicholas Pavlik in 2011. Processed to the folder level by Alice Griffin in 2022.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection assembled in 1936 from various donations. Materials are generally arranged by category.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains bank notes, fractional currency, and treasury notes printed in the State of New York and various other American states during the period 1690 to 1904, with the bulk dating from 1775 to 1865. Also included are various forms of paper currency printed by the Confederate States of America during the Civil War, as well as currency printed by various other countries, such as Argentina, China, Dominican Republic, and Japan. Two bound volumes containing historical sketches of paper money printed in the continental United States and the State of Pennsylvania are also included.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Material in this collection is in the public domain.

odd.head: Language of Materials
odd.p: Materials primarily in English, with some materials in Japanese, Spanish, and Chinese.
